description: Reinstatement of historical detailing to front elevation; replacement of existing rear extension at upper ground floor; lowering of basement floor level and extension into the garden; removal of tree in rear garden; ASHP in garden; relocation of window in side elevation; replacement of roof finishes and installation of photovoltaic panels; and replacement of front boundary.
decision_conditions:
The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

<p>Details of materials to be used on the external surfaces of the building shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing, before any work commences on site. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the building under Sections 16 and 66 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, December 2024, Paragraphs 202 to 221; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</p>

<p>Prior to the commencement of the relevant part of the work, the applicant shall submit, and have approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, a detailed layout, cross sections (scale 1:20), full specifications and a detailed management and maintenance plan of the biodiverse roof with a minimum substrate depth of 80mm, not including the vegetative mat. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved and shall be fully implemented before the premises are first occupied.</p><p>REASON: To ensure compliance with biodiversity requirements</p>

<p>The development hereby approved shall be operated in full compliance with the noise levels outlined in the submitted noise impact assessment report by 'NOVA acoustics report reference NP-012050 dated 10/02/2025', ensuring that the rating level of noise emissions from the air conditioning unit does not exceed that specified within the document. Should any changes to the approved plant or equipment occur, a new noise assessment must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate continued compliance with BS4142:2014+A1:2019.</p><p>REASON: To safeguard the amenity of neighbouring occupiers and ensure compliance with Policy LP2 of Hackney’s Local Plan and the London Plan’s strategic noise policies.</p>

<p>The works hereby approved shall not be carried out unless in accordance with the approved Tree Protection Plan. The measures set out in the Tree Protection Plan shall remain in place until the completion of the construction.</p><p>Reason: To safeguard existing tree(s) in the interests of visual amenity, having regard to Policy LP51 in the Local Plan 2033 (adopted 2020).</p>

<p>Following the removal of the tree as permitted by this decision, the tree shall be replaced by one of an appropriate species in the same vicinity as agreed by the Local Planning Authority. The replacement trees shall be planted during the planting season current at the time of felling (end October - end March) or during the next immediately available planting season. The size of the trees shall be at least a Light Standard as per BS 3936-1:1992 (or any standard that reproduces or replaces this standard). The trees shall be maintained for 5 years after planting and should they be removed, die, be severely damaged or become seriously diseased within this period they shall be replaced with another tree as originally required to be planted by this condition.</p><p>Reason: In the interests of safeguarding the benefits provided by trees, having regard to Policy LP51 in the Local Plan 2033 (adopted 2020).</p>
